legal_basis: Notice is given under article 5 of the Statistics of Trade and Employment (Northern Ireland) Order 1988.
title: Digital Economy Survey 2022

title.text: You are completing this for {ru_name} {conditional_trad_as}

description.text: If the company details or structure have changed contact us on {telephone_number_link} or email {email_link}

contents.description: This survey measures information about the digital economy, including e-commerce and use of technology.

list: Data should relate to all sites in England, Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland unless otherwise stated.
You can provide informed estimates if actual figures are not available.
We will treat your data securely and confidentially.
You still need to complete this survey even if it does not seem relevant. All returns are important as it helps us produce better statistics.
You can save a copy of your answers at the end of this questionnaire using the ‘Download as PDF’ button.

contents.description: View the survey information and questions before you start the survey (this link opens in a new tab)
What we mean by 'e-commerce'

This is the sale or purchase of goods or services conducted over computer networks by methods specifically designed for the purpose of receiving or placing orders, via a website, app or Electronic Data Interchange (EDI).
The payment and the delivery of the goods or services do not have to be conducted online.
E-commerce transactions exclude orders made by manually typed email.

questions.question: Access to, and use of, the internet

contents.description: In this section you will be asked to provide information on:

list: internet access
internet connection
use of a website, app and social media pages
use of digital marketing strategies

contents.description: In this section you will be asked to provide information on:

list: turnover from e-commerce sales to customers located in the UK and outside the UK
types of customers located outside the UK
types of goods and services sold via e-commerce to customers located outside the UK
platforms used to make e-commerce sales to customers located outside the UK
difficulties when selling to customers located in European Union Countries via a website or app
difficulties when selling via an online marketplace

contents.description: For e-commerce sales to customers located outside the UK, you will also be asked to provide information on the value of turnover from sales by geographical area.
In this section you will be asked to provide information on:

list: expenditure on e-commerce purchases from suppliers located in the UK and outside the UK
types of suppliers located outside the UK from which e-commerce purchases were made
types of goods and services purchased via e-commerce from suppliers located outside the UK
types of platforms used to make e-commerce purchases from suppliers located outside the UK

contents.description: For e-commerce purchases from suppliers located outside the UK, you will also be asked to provide information on expenditure on purchases by geographical area.

questions.question: Sales and purchases of digitally delivered services

contents.description: In this section you will be asked to provide information on:

list: turnover from sales of digitally delivered services ordered non-digitally to customers located in the UK and outside the UK
expenditure on purchases of digitally delivered services ordered non-digitally from suppliers located in the UK and outside the UK

contents.description: In this section you will be asked to provide information on:

list: income received from fees charged by your business for providing digital intermediary platform services
value of goods sold through your platform
value of services sold through your platform
amount your business pays to a digital intermediary platform to sell your products

contents.description: What we mean by 'digital intermediary platforms'
This refers to a digital marketplace that facilitates the direct interaction between multiple buyers and multiple sellers who interact through the service via the internet.
A digital intermediary platform usually facilitates these interactions for a fee, but it could also be funded by advertisements.
A digital intermediary platform does not typically own the goods or services, but has the facility for sellers to provide these, either in digital or physical form, via the platform.
An online marketplace is a type of digital intermediary platform.

questions.question: Use of business software and cloud computing

contents.description: In this section you will be asked to provide information on:

list: use of, and expenditure on, business software such as accountancy software, Customer Relationship Management (CRM) software and Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) software
any cloud computing services that your business uses over the internet

contents.description: In this section you will be asked to provide information on:

list: any additional actions required to ensure compliance with digital regulations
any difficulties experienced when ensuring compliance with digital regulations

contents.description: In this section you will be asked to provide information on your business's ICT security measures.
What we mean by 'ICT security'
This refers to measures, controls and procedures applied to ICT systems in order to ensure integrity, authenticity, availability and confidentiality of data and systems.

list: You cannot appeal your selection. Your business was selected to give us a comprehensive view of the UK economy.
The information you provide contributes to statistics on digital trade, business use of the internet and other technology.

sections.title: Access to, and use of, the internet

content.title: Access to, and use of, the internet

title.text: What percentage of people in {ru_name} use internet-enabled devices for work purposes?

contents.description: Include:

list: employees, directors and proprietors
all agency staff on your payroll

contents.description: Exclude:

list: agency staff not on your payroll

contents.description: Include:

list: personal computers
portable computers such as laptops, netbooks, notebooks and tablets
other portable devices such as smartphones and Personal Digital Assistants (PDAs)

contents.description: Exclude:

list: terminals and computers solely used for Electronic Point of Sale (EPOS)

answers.label: Percentage of people using internet-enabled devices for work

question.title: Does your business use a fixed broadband connection to the internet for work purposes?

contents.description: Include:

list: connections to the internet using telephone lines, for example, DSL
public Wi-Fi

definitions.title: Examples of fixed broadband connections to the internet

list: digital subscriber line, such as, ADSL, SDSL and VDSL
fibre optic technology (FTTP)
cable technology

options.label: Yes, the business uses a fixed broadband connection
options.value: Yes, the business uses a fixed broadband connection

options.label: No, the business does not use a fixed broadband connection
options.value: No, the business does not use a fixed broadband connection

in: No, the business does not use a fixed broadband connection

question.title: What is the maximum contracted download speed of the fastest fixed internet connection used by your business?
description: Mbps or megabits per second are units of measurement for network bandwidth and throughput.

options.label: Yes, the internet speed is sufficient for our needs
options.value: Yes, the internet speed is sufficient for our needs

options.label: No, the internet speed is not sufficient for our needs
options.value: No, the internet speed is not sufficient for our needs

options.label: Website placed via third party
options.description: For example, Amazon store page or TripAdvisor agency page

search engine optimisation
web traffic analysis

contents.description: This refers to the sale of goods or services conducted over computer networks by methods specifically designed for the purpose of receiving orders via a website, app or Electronic Data Interchange (EDI).
The payment and the delivery of the goods or services do not have to be conducted online.
E-commerce transactions exclude orders made by manually typed email.
This refers to a collection of web pages arranged together to provide information or advice. It can consist of text, graphics, sound, video or a combination of these.
This refers to mobile applications usually downloaded from an app store onto a mobile phone, tablet or other device.

contents.title: What we mean by 'Electronic Data Interchange (EDI)'

contents.description: This refers to messages and information sent and received by electronic transmission methods and can be processed automatically, for example, internet or non-internet EDI, XML and EDIFACT.

title.text: During 2022, did {ru_name} make any e-commerce sales?

contents.description: Include:

list: reservations made online that resulted in making a sale
sales made to a parent or affiliate company not reported on this questionnaire
sales made via third-party websites and online marketplaces, for example, Alibaba, Amazon, Amazon Business, Booking, eBay, Etsy and Rakuten
sales made by a digital intermediary platform

contents.description: Exclude:

list: sales where the order was placed via manually typed email, telephone call or fax
items sold via self-service checkouts, such as, in supermarkets
enquiries or reservations that did not result in making a sale

contents.description: This refers to the sale of goods, services, materials and utilities conducted over computer networks by methods specifically designed for the purpose of receiving or placing orders via a website, app or EDI.
The payment and the delivery of the goods or services do not have to be conducted online.

contents.description: Include e-commerce sales to customers located in the UK and outside the UK

definitions.title: What we mean by an 'online marketplace'

contents.description: This refers to a website or app used by several businesses for trading products.
Examples of online marketplaces:

list: Alibaba
Amazon
Amazon Business
Booking
eBay
Etsy
Rakuten

options.label: Changes to your account or product listings by the platform
options.value: Changes to your account or product listings by the platform
options.description: This includes suspension and removal

options.description: For example, difficulty contacting the platform or resolving disputes

options.label: Difficulties with information exchange
options.description: For example, not receiving enough information about the platform or the platform receiving too much information about your business

options.label: Fees and commission charged by the platform
options.value: Fees and commission charged by the platform

options.label: Issues relating to the terms and conditions between the platform and your business
options.value: Issues relating to the terms and conditions between the platform and your business

options.label: Pricing of products on the platform
options.value: Pricing of products on the platform

options.label: The processing of payments and refunds
options.value: The processing of payments and refunds

options.label: The sale of similar products by the platform itself
options.value: The sale of similar products by the platform itself

answers.description: Enter the full value (e.g. 56,234.33) or a value to the nearest £thousand (e.g. 56,000). Do not enter ‘56’ for 56,000. Enter '0', rather than leave blank.

question.title: During 2022, what platforms did your business use to make e-commerce purchases from suppliers located outside the UK?

options.label: Purchases through an app or website owned by another business

description:
Values given should match with the platforms selected in the previous question.

Values should sum to your business's expenditure on e-commerce purchases from suppliers located outside the UK.

An informed estimate is acceptable.

contents.description: Enter the full value (e.g. 56,234.33) or a value to the nearest £thousand (e.g. 56,000). Do not enter ‘56’ for 56,000. Enter '0', rather than leave blank.

answers.label: Expenditure on e-commerce purchases via a website or app owned by another business

answers.label: Expenditure on e-commerce purchases via other platforms

sections.title: Sales and purchases of digitally delivered services ordered non-digitally

content.title: Sales and purchases of digitally delivered services

contents.description: In this section you will be asked to provide information on:

list: turnover from sales of digitally delivered services ordered non-digitally to customers located in the UK and outside the UK
expenditure on purchases of digitally delivered services ordered non-digitally from suppliers located in the UK and outside the UK

contents.description: What we mean by 'digitally delivered services ordered non-digitally'
This refers to services delivered in an electronic format, that were ordered non-digitally.
Examples of digitally delivered services:

list: insurance and financial services
consultancy services
computer services
marketing services
streaming music, films, television and radio
online games and e-books

contents.description: Examples of non-digital ordering methods:

list: fax
letter
verbal communication
manually typed email

question.title: During 2022, what was your business’s turnover from the sale of services that were ordered non-digitally but were digitally delivered?

contents.description: Exclude:

list: VAT
e-commerce sales

online games and e-books

contents.description: In this section you will be asked to provide information on:

list: income received from fees charged by your business for providing digital intermediary platform services
value of goods sold through your platform
value of services sold through your platform
amount your business pays to a digital intermediary platform to sell your products

contents.title: What we mean by 'digital intermediary platforms'

contents.description: This refers to a digital marketplace that facilitates the direct interaction between multiple buyers and multiple sellers who interact through the service via the internet.
A digital intermediary platform usually facilitates these interactions for a fee, but it could also be funded by advertisements.
A digital intermediary platform does not typically own the goods or services, but has the facility for sellers to provide these, either in digital or physical form, via the platform.
An online marketplace is a type of digital intermediary platform.

list: Facebook
online marketplaces, such as, Amazon, Etsy and Rakuten

title.text: During 2022, did {ru_name} provide a digital intermediary platform service?

definitions.title: What we mean by 'digital intermediary platform'

contents.description: This refers to a digital marketplace that facilitates the direct interaction between multiple buyers and multiple sellers who interact through the service via the internet.
A digital intermediary platform usually facilitates these interactions for a fee, but it could also be funded by advertisements, for example, Facebook.
A digital intermediary platform does not typically own the goods or services, but has the facility for sellers to provide these, either in digital or physical form, via the platform.
Examples of digital intermediary platforms:

list: Facebook
online marketplaces, such as, Amazon, Etsy and Rakuten

options.label: Yes, the business provided a digital intermediary platform service
options.value: Yes, the business provided a digital intermediary platform service

options.label: No, the business did not provide a digital intermediary platform service
options.value: No, the business did not provide a digital intermediary platform service

in: No, the business did not provide a digital intermediary platform service

question.title: During 2022, how much did your business pay to a digital intermediary platform to sell your goods and services?

definitions.title: What we mean by 'digital intermediary platform'

contents.description: This refers to a digital marketplace that facilitates the direct interaction between multiple buyers and multiple sellers who interact through the service via the internet.
A digital intermediary platform usually facilitates these interactions for a fee, but it could also be funded by advertisements, for example, Facebook.
A digital intermediary platform does not typically own the goods or services, but has the facility for sellers to provide these, either in digital or physical form, via the platform.
Examples of digital intermediary platforms:

list: Facebook
online marketplaces, such as, Amazon, Etsy and Rakuten

sections.title: Use of business software and cloud computing

content.title: Use of business software and cloud computing

contents.description: In this section you will be asked to provide information on:

list: use of, and expenditure on, business software such as: accountancy software, Customer Relationship Management (CRM) software and Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) software
any cloud computing services that your business uses over the internet

contents.title: What we mean by 'cloud computing services'

contents.description: This refers to services used over the internet, including connections via Virtual Private Networks (VPN) to access software, computing power and storage capacity.
Cloud computing services:

list: are delivered from servers of service providers
can be used as an on-demand self-service, at least after set up, without human interaction with a service provider
can be scaled up or down, for example, for a change in number of users or storage capacity
are paid by use or per capacity used, or they are prepaid

title.text: Does {ru_name} use any of the following software?

options.label: Accountancy software
options.description: Exclude cloud-based accountancy software

options.label: Customer Relationship Management (CRM) software
options.description: This refers to any software application for managing information about customers. Exclude cloud-based CRM software

options.label: Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) software
options.description: A software package used to manage resources by sharing information among different functional areas, for example, accounting, planning, production and marketing. Include both cloud and non-cloud-based ERP software

options.label: Business does not use any of this software
options.value: Business does not use any of this software

question.title: During 2022, what was your business's expenditure on any software?

contents.description: Include:

list: initial purchase of software
purchase of licences for software
recurring subscription costs
ongoing maintenance and upgrades

contents.description: Exclude:

list: purchases of physical hardware

contents.description: Software is a generic term used to refer to applications, scripts and programs that run on a device.

answers.label: Expenditure on software
answers.description: Enter the full value (e.g. 56,234.33) or a value to the nearest £thousand (e.g. 56,000). Do not enter ‘56’ for 56,000. Enter '0', rather than leave blank.

title.text: How much of the {expenditure_on_software} expenditure on software, was on each of the following?

description:
Enter the full value (e.g. 56,234.33) or a value to the nearest £thousand (e.g. 56,000). Do not enter ‘56’ for 56,000. Enter '0', rather than leave blank.

Informed estimates are acceptable.

Values do not need to sum the total spent on purchasing all software.

contents.description: Include:

list: initial purchase of software
purchase of licences for software
recurring subscription costs
ongoing maintenance and upgrades

answers.label: Expenditure on online accountancy software
Expenditure on Customer Relationship Management (CRM) software
answers.description: This refers to any software application for managing information about customers

answers.label: Expenditure on E-commerce software
answers.description: This refers to initial purchase, maintenance or upgrade of your business's website, app or EDI system

answers.label: Expenditure on Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) software
answers.description: This refers to a software package used to manage resources by sharing information among different functional areas. For example, accounting, planning, production and marketing

definitions.title: What we mean by 'cloud computing services'

contents.description: This refers to services used over the internet, including connections via Virtual Private Networks (VPN) to access software, computing power and storage capacity.
Cloud computing services:

list: are delivered from servers of service providers
can be used as an on-demand self-service, at least after set up, without human interaction with a service provider
can be scaled up or down, for example, for a change in number of users or storage capacity
are paid by use or per capacity used, or they are prepaid

options.label: Computing capacity to run your own software

contents.description: In this section you will be asked to provide information on:

list: any additional actions required to ensure compliance with digital regulations
any difficulties experienced when ensuring compliance with digital regulations
having a website
making e-commerce sales
using social media
using computer programming
using information sharing software
data protection regulations
competition law
platform to business regulation

question.title: When engaging in digital activities, did your business need to take any of the following actions to ensure compliance to regulations?

list: data protection regulations
competition law
platform to business regulation

options.label: Adapted business plans or activities
options.description: For example, changed the way goods or services are delivered

options.label: Engaged with government
options.description: For example, UK government officials, local government officials or devolved government officials

options.label: Engaged with regulators
options.description: For example, Ofcom, ICO or CMA

options.label: Used legal resources
options.description: For example, contracting external legal advice or consulting internal legal teams

guidance.show_guidance: Why are we asking this question?
guidance.hide_guidance: Why are we asking this question?

contents.description: We want to be able to measure and understand the impact of the government's digital regulations on businesses.

question.title: What, if any, difficulties did your business face when ensuring compliance to regulations?

options.label: Compliance with regulations increased the cost of your activities
options.value: Compliance with regulations increased the cost of your activities

options.label: Compliance with regulations slowed down your ability to deliver your product or service
options.value: Compliance with regulations slowed down your ability to deliver your product or service

options.label: Difficulties complying with regulations required you to cease some activities
options.value: Difficulties complying with regulations required you to cease some activities

options.label: Difficulty understanding how or what regulations apply to your business
options.value: Difficulty understanding how or what regulations apply to your business

options.label: Business did not experience any difficulties
options.value: Business did not experience any difficulties

guidance.show_guidance: Why are we asking this question?
guidance.hide_guidance: Why are we asking this question?

contents.description: We want to be able to measure and understand the impact of the government's digital regulations on businesses.
In this section you will be asked to provide information on your business's ICT security measures.
What we mean by 'ICT security'
This refers to measures, controls and procedures applied to ICT systems in order to ensure integrity, authenticity, availability and confidentiality of data and systems.

title.text: Does {ru_name} use any of the following ICT security measures?

contents.description: This refers to measures, controls and procedures applied to ICT systems in order to ensure integrity, authenticity, availability and confidentiality of data and systems.

options.label: Access control to business network
options.description: For example, management of user access rights

options.label: Encryption techniques for data, documents or email
options.value: Encryption techniques for data, documents or email

options.label: ICT risk assessment
options.description: For example, periodic assessment of probability and consequences of ICT security incidents

options.label: ICT security tests
options.description: For example, performing penetration tests, review of security measures, testing of back-up systems and testing security alert systems

options.label: Keeping software and operating systems updated
options.value: Keeping software and operating systems updated

options.label: Offsite data back-up
options.description: For example, physical or electronic back-up including the cloud

options.label: Strong password authentication
options.description: For example, a minimum length of 8 mixed alpha and numeric characters with periodic changes

options.label: User identification and authentication via biometric methods
options.value: User identification and authentication via biometric methods
options.description: For example, faces, fingerprints and voices

options.label: Virtual Private Network (VPN)
options.description: This extends a private network across a public network, to enable secure exchange of data over a public network

options.label: Business does not use any of these security measures
options.value: Business does not use any of these security measures

question.title: Please provide any further details that will help us understand your answers and tell an industry story

description.text:
Explain any significant changes to {ru_name}'s e-commerce sales or purchases and your use of Information and Communication Technology (ICT).

If you provide comments, we are less likely to contact you with data queries.

Make sure you continue to the next page and select 'submit answers' at the bottom.

contents.description: Please include details of:

list: any zero figures

contents.description: Any significant impacts upon your data resulting from changes to your business. For example:

list: changes to your business structure
changes in the type of activities undertaken
changes in your digital operations and ICT capability
any significant changes to your data since your last submission, if applicable

answers.label: Comments

contents.description: Learn more about how we use this data

submission.title: Check your answers and submit
submission.warning: You must submit this survey to complete it
submission.guidance: You will have the opportunity to view, save or print a copy of your answers after submitting this survey.
